results.content: On Infuria I was not able to get the contract to deploy and what is seed information is that something we just enter? Plus at the time of this video @truffle/hdwallet-provider was introduced and truffle-hdwallet-provider is now deprecated I can at least say that I'm able to use it on meta mask and not infuria for now.

results.content:
First thing, I should say, the course provides enough basics to understand the concept of blockchain and smart contracts. 

However, I was a bit disappointed to see that the focus is shifted towards web development around implementation of interaction between web page and smart contract, while I was looking for a deep dive into smart contract development and trying to come out from the course with my own contract for a cryptocurrency. This is giving some frustration because the "About this course" section states "Become a Blockchain Developer by creating your own ICO-Cryptocurrency with Ethereum & Solidity", but in reality 75% of the course is built around coding with React, JS and working with APIs. But as I have not been too much exposed to working with React, I'd admit that this part was helpful and useful for me, and I found it interesting.

Lastly, some parts of the course weren't quite understandable due to instructor is not a native English speaker. But this is my fault for not looking at previews of the course, as I was eager to jump in and rushed to buy the course based on high ratings of the previous students (if they are not fake ratings, of course :-)

Considering the price of some $12 that I paid for this course,  I think it is not expensive for the knowledge that I got in turn. Not claiming a refund -- there is something to improve for all -- the platform, the instructor and myself.
results.content_html:
First thing, I should say, the course provides enough basics to understand the concept of blockchain and smart contracts.

However, I was a bit disappointed to see that the focus is shifted towards web development around implementation of interaction between web page and smart contract, while I was looking for a deep dive into smart contract development and trying to come out from the course with my own contract for a cryptocurrency. This is giving some frustration because the "About this course" section states "Become a Blockchain Developer by creating your own ICO-Cryptocurrency with Ethereum & Solidity", but in reality 75% of the course is built around coding with React, JS and working with APIs. But as I have not been too much exposed to working with React, I'd admit that this part was helpful and useful for me, and I found it interesting.

Lastly, some parts of the course weren't quite understandable due to instructor is not a native English speaker. But this is my fault for not looking at previews of the course, as I was eager to jump in and rushed to buy the course based on high ratings of the previous students (if they are not fake ratings, of course :-)

Considering the price of some $12 that I paid for this course, I think it is not expensive for the knowledge that I got in turn. Not claiming a refund -- there is something to improve for all -- the platform, the instructor and myself.
